items: Stand at the top of your mat with your feet hip-width apart and your arms at your sides.
Step your left foot back about 3-4 feet, turning your left foot out at a 45-degree angle.
Bend your right knee, keeping it directly over your ankle, and sink your hips down towards the floor.
Extend your arms out to the sides, parallel to the floor, with your palms facing down.
Gaze over your right fingertips and hold for several breaths.
To come out of the pose, straighten your right leg and step your left foot forward to meet your right foot.
Repeat on the other side, stepping your right foot back and bending your left knee.
Strengthens the upper body, particularly the back, biceps, and shoulders
Increases overall body control and stability
Can be modified to increase or decrease difficulty
Can be done with minimal equipment
